item.title: Using Angular's Base HREF in Paths
item.description: I was recently working with a client and they were having an odd problem with Angular. They'd build their Angular apps in isolation then move them into an ASP.NET Core project and their asset links would break. Let's look at why this happens and how to address it.

item.title: Dimmer won't turn off - Offizielles Shelly Support Forum
item.description: I just got my first dimmer and installed it to some leds in my living room. The problem is that the leds will not turn off completely when I turn it off in the app or on the physical switch. It only dims down to maybe 40% and when I dim it down to 1%…

item.title: Very fast rocket
Behind the scenes: the struggle for each paper
item.description: The start of my sabbatical has given me a moment to reflect on my publications. But my CV only shows a list of neatly cataloged papers: title, authors, conference. Each one appearing no different from another. But how each paper ended up published is its own story, a story about people and opportunity.

item.title: The logic behind three random words
item.description: Whilst not a password panacea, using 'three random words' is still better than enforcing arbitrary complexity requirements.
item.author: (Written By)

item.title: Figmage: I don't mess with images
item.description: I hate working with images. It’s the most tedious part of making websites and writing blog posts. In fact, sometimes I dread it so much, that I don’t publish posts because I have to make the assets for them. too many images everywhere And if you muster up the energy to make them, it’s a cycle of uploads and re-uploads till you get the right resolution, size and colors.

item.title: How does FaceTime Work?

item.title: Apple to scan U.S. iPhones for images of child sexual abuse
item.description: Apple unveiled plans to scan U.S. iPhones for images of child sexual abuse, drawing applause from child protection groups but raising concern among some security researchers that the system could be misused, including by governments looking to surveil their citizens.
item.author: (By FRANK BAJAK and BARBARA ORTUTAY)
